main.name: Divya Raj
main.description: An aspiring student with a flair for perfection. Good at making mobile apps, hacking up a solution to a problem and editing videos. Talk video games to me and you're my best friend
main.bio:
I've been coding for the last 5 years, starting with C/C++, moving on to Java, and then Python and JS. I've made some cool projects as I went along, solidifying my understanding of everything I learnt. 
Currently, I'm pursuing an undergraduate degree in Computer Science from Shiv Nadar University, graduating in 2020.
 I have one internship under my belt and three of my apps are currently on the Play Store. I've just got into ML and AI and planning to make some kickass projects there as well...
I've always been a fan of video games and it's infact my love for games that got me into CS. Even though I'm much busier now, I'll always find time for a good game :)
Contact me on any of my socials for work related stuff or just general chit chat... I'm all ears.
main.contactmessage:
Want to have a chat? 
Just write your mail down below to get in touch...

address.street: E-215, Palam Vihar Extension, Dharam Colony

work.title: Android Development Intern
work.description:
Summer Internship, in which I worked on their new Android application ”Lookup”, a real estate app that automatically picks up empty properties, and suggests them to buyers.
• Working with REST APIs.
• Chat SDK integration.
• Optimizing and building new UI on top of the already existing one.

projects.title: UniPool
projects.category: Android app providing a platform for students to find potential cab-poolers, which makes the cab more affordable for students.

projects.title: ShareBear
projects.category: A sharing platform for my university. A React Native app

projects.title: Adventures Of Dynamo
projects.category: An RPG game I made back in 2013. My first game :)

projects.title: Virtual Cricket
projects.category: A C++ game simulating the classic school game of Odd-Eve cricket.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Divya Raj must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
